intro: Pithecoctenium cinereum, commonly known as the black sand vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are ovate with a rough texture and often have a waxy coating. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
